memories.content: When implementing authentication, always hash passwords using bcrypt with a salt rounds of at least 12 for security. Never store plain text passwords in the database.
The user prefers TypeScript over JavaScript for better type safety. All new code should be written in TypeScript when possible.
Database migrations should always be reversible. Include both up and down migration scripts to ensure we can rollback changes if needed.
API endpoints should follow RESTful conventions. Use proper HTTP status codes: 200 for success, 201 for creation, 400 for client errors, 500 for server errors.
